    public class CcddGroupTreeHandler
extends CcddInformationTreeHandler
    CFS Command and Data Dictionary group tree handler class

    • Constructor Detail

      • CcddGroupTreeHandler

        CcddGroupTreeHandler(CcddMain ccddMain,
                     CcddUndoHandler undoHandler,
                     java.lang.String scheduleRate,
                     boolean isApplicationOnly,
                     java.awt.Component parent)
        Group tree handler class constructor
        Parameters:
        ccddMain - main class
        undoHandler - reference to the undo handler
        scheduleRate - string value representing a schedule rate used to filter the groups that may be selected; null or blank if not filtering
        isApplicationOnly - true if only groups that represent CFS applications should be displayed
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog

      • removeSelectedGroups

        protected void removeSelectedGroups()

      • addInformationNode

        protected CcddClassesComponent.ToolTipTreeNode[] addInformationNode(java.lang.String nodeName,
                                                                    java.lang.String toolTipText,
                                                                    boolean isApp,
                                                                    boolean isAddTableTypes)
        Add a new node to the tree's root node, or the application node is filtering by application is active. Add the table types as nodes to the new node depending on the supplied flag
        Parameters:
        nodeName - name of the node to add
        toolTipText - tool tip text for the new node
        isApp - true if the group represents a CFS application
        isAddTableTypes - true if nodes with the names of the table types should be added to the new node
        Returns:
        Array of table type nodes added to the group node; null if the table type nodes aren't added

      • buildTree

        protected void buildTree(boolean filterByApp,
                         java.lang.String scheduleRate,
                         boolean isApplicationOnly,
                         java.awt.Component parent)
        Build the group tree
        Overrides:
        buildTree in class CcddInformationTreeHandler
        Parameters:
        filterByApp - true if the tree is filtered by application status
        scheduleRate - schedule rate used to filter the groups; blank or null if not filtering by schedule rate
        isApplicationOnly - true to only display groups that represent a CFS application
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog

      • buildTree

        protected void buildTree(java.lang.String groupName,
                         boolean isApplication,
                         java.awt.Component parent)
        Build the group tree following a change in the group's application status
        Parameters:
        groupName - name of the group with the application status change
        isApplication - true if the group represents a CFS application
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog

        protected void setHeaderNodeEnable()

                                 java.lang.Object[] sourcePath,
                                 int startIndex)
        Add the specified table(s) to the specified group node(s)
        Overrides:
        addNodeToInfoNode in class CcddInformationTreeHandler
        Parameters:
        node - parent information node for this table
        sourcePath - array containing the source node path
        startIndex - tree level at which the table names first appear in the array

      • addLeafDefinition

        protected void addLeafDefinition(java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> treeDefns,
                                 java.lang.String[] leafDefn,
                                 java.lang.String filterValue)
        Override adding a group definition entry in order to look for and prune duplicates. Duplicates can occur if the tree is filtered by table type
        Overrides:
        addLeafDefinition in class CcddInformationTreeHandler
        Parameters:
        treeDefns - list to which to add the leaf definition
        leafDefn - leaf definition to add to the list
        filterValue - string value that may be used to modify the tree; null or blank if not used

      • adjustNodeText

        protected void adjustNodeText(CcddClassesComponent.ToolTipTreeNode startNode,
                              java.util.List<java.lang.String> excludes)
        Set the node text color based on the currently selected schedule rate and the rate of the group to which the node belongs: black for a match and gray for a mismatch
        Parameters:
        startNode - starting node for which to adjust the text and color
        excludes - list of groups names to be excluded (group name is grayed out in the tree)

      • removeSelectedItemNodes

        protected void removeSelectedItemNodes()
        Remove the currently selected item node(s) from the tree. If a header node is selected then remove all of its item nodes

      • getItemNodes

        private java.util.List<CcddClassesComponent.ToolTipTreeNode> getItemNodes(CcddClassesComponent.ToolTipTreeNode node,
                                                                          java.util.List<CcddClassesComponent.ToolTipTreeNode> itemNodes)
        Add the specified node to the list of item nodes if it represents an item. If this is a header node then get the item nodes from the header's child nodes. This is a recursive method
        Parameters:
        node - node to add to the list if the node represents an item, or a header node
        itemNodes - list containing the item nodes
        Returns:
        List containing the item nodes

      • createTreePanel

        protected javax.swing.JPanel createTreePanel(java.lang.String label,
                                             int selectionMode,
                                             boolean noFilters,
                                             java.awt.Component parent)
        Create a group tree panel. The table tree is placed in a scroll pane. A check box is added that allows tree expansion/collapse
        Parameters:
        label - group tree title
        selectionMode - tree item selection mode (single versus multiple)
        noFilters - true to not display the filter check boxes
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog
        Returns:
        JPanel containing the group tree components
